for (key, value) in someDict {
   print("å­—å…¸ key \(key) -  å­—å…¸ value \(value)")
}
for (key, value) in someDict.enumerated() {
    print("å­—å…¸ key \(key) -  å­—å…¸ (key, value) å¯¹ \(value)")
}

  22. å‡½æ•°ï¼š

    func funcname(å½¢å‚) -> returntype

  23. å‡½æ•°ï¼šå…ƒç»„ä½œä¸ºå‡½æ•°è¿”å›å€¼; å¯é€‰å…ƒç»„è¿”å›ç±»å‹

    func minMax(array: [Int]) -> (min: Int, max: Int)? {
	return (-1,10)
}

  24. å‡½æ•°ï¼šå±€éƒ¨å‚æ•°åå‰æŒ‡å®šå¤–éƒ¨å‚æ•°å.

    //firstArgæ˜¯å¤–éƒ¨å‚æ•°å aæ˜¯å†…éƒ¨å‚æ•°å
func pow(firstArg a: Int, secondArg b: Int) -> Int {
   var res = a
   for _ in 1..<b {
      res = res * a
   }
   print(res)
   return res
}
pow(firstArg:5, secondArg:3)

  25. å‡½æ•°ï¼šå¯å˜å‚æ•°

    func sum(input: Int...) -> Int {
	Int sum = 0
	for a in input{
        sum += a
	}
    return a
}
print("result:\(sum(1,2,3,4,5))")

  26. å‡½æ•°ï¼šå˜é‡å‚æ•°ï¼Œå¯ä»¥åœ¨å‚æ•°å®šä¹‰å‰åŠ  inout å…³é”®å­—

    func swapTwoInts(_ a: inout Int, _ b: inout Int) {
    let temporaryA = a
    a = b
    b = temporaryA
}
var x = 1
var y = 5
swapTwoInts(&x, &y)
print("x ç°åœ¨çš„å€¼ \(x), y ç°åœ¨çš„å€¼ \(y)")

  27. å‡½æ•°ç±»å‹

    func sum(a: Int, b: Int) -> Int {
   return a + b
}
var addition: (Int, Int) -> Int = sum
print("è¾“å‡ºç»“æœ: \(addition(40, 89))")

  28. å‡½æ•°ï¼šå°†å‡½æ•°ä½œä¸ºå‚æ•°ä¼ é€’ç»™å¦å¤–ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°

    func sum(a: Int, b: Int) -> Int {
    return a + b
}
var addition: (Int, Int) -> Int = sum
print("è¾“å‡ºç»“æœ: \(addition(40, 89))")
func another(addition: (Int, Int) -> Int, a: Int, b: Int) {
    print("è¾“å‡ºç»“æœ: \(addition(a, b))")
}
another(addition: sum, a: 10, b: 20)

  29. å‡½æ•°åµŒå¥—:å‡½æ•°å¼ç¼–ç¨‹

  30. é—­åŒ…(Closures)

    // ä»¥ä¸‹é—­åŒ…ä»¥Arrayçš„sortedå‡½æ•°ä¸ºä¾‹
    func testClosure() {
        let names = ["Chris", "Alex", "Ewa", "Barry", "Daniella"]
        func backward(_ str1: String, _ str2: String) -> Bool {
            return str1 > str2
        }
            
        // sortedå‡½æ•°çš„å‚æ•°æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªé—­åŒ…ï¼Œä¸‹é¢ä¼ äº†ä¸€ä¸ªæ–¹æ³•åï¼Œç”±æ­¤è¯´æ˜ï¼šåµŒå¥—å‡½æ•°æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæœ‰åå­—ä½†å¹¶å¯ä»¥æ•è·å…¶å°é—­å‡½æ•°åŸŸå†…å€¼çš„é—­åŒ…
        var reversedNames = names.sorted(by: backward)
            
        // æ™®é€šé—­åŒ…æ ¼å¼ï¼š(å‚æ•°: å‚æ•°ç±»å‹,...) -> è¿”å›å€¼ç±»å‹ in ...
        reversedNames = names.sorted(by: {(_ str1: String, _ str2: String) -> Bool in return str1 > str2})
            
        // æ ¹æ®Swiftçš„ç±»å‹æ¨æ–­ï¼Œå‚æ•°ç±»å‹åŠå‚æ•°æ‹¬å·å¯ä»¥å»æ‰ï¼Œè¿”å›å€¼ç±»å‹å¯ä»¥å»æ‰
        reversedNames = names.sorted(by: {str1, str2 in return str1 > str2})
           
        // å•è¡Œè¡¨è¾¾å¼ï¼šå¯ä»¥å»æ‰return
        reversedNames = names.sorted(by: {str1, str2 in str1 > str2})
            
        // ä½¿ç”¨å‚æ•°åç¼©å†™ï¼šå‚æ•°å’Œinä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥å»æ‰
        reversedNames = names.sorted(by: {$0 > $1})
           
        // ä½¿ç”¨è¿ç®—ç¬¦ï¼šå› ä¸ºSwiftä¸­ä¸ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²é‡è½½äº†å¤§äºå·å°äºå·
        reversedNames = names.sorted(by: >)
            
        // ä½¿ç”¨å°¾éšé—­åŒ…ï¼šå‰ææ˜¯é—­åŒ…å¿…é¡»æ˜¯å‡½æ•°çš„æœ€åä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°
        reversedNames = names.sorted() {$0 < $1}
            
        // ä½¿ç”¨å°¾éšé—­åŒ…ï¼šé—­åŒ…æ˜¯å‡½æ•°å”¯ä¸€å‚æ•°æ—¶ï¼Œå¯ä»¥çœæ‰å‚æ•°æ‹¬å·
        reversedNames = names.sorted {$0 < $1}
            
        print(reversedNames)
    }

  31. å‡½æ•°å’Œé—­åŒ…éƒ½æ˜¯å¼•ç”¨ç±»å‹

  32. æšä¸¾ï¼Œè·ŸOC/Cæœ‰å¾ˆå¤§ä¸åŒ ï¼š1.ç±»å‹å¯ä»¥å¤šç§ï¼Œ2.æ²¡æœ‰èµ‹äºˆé»˜è®¤å€¼ 3.è¯­æ³•ä¸ç¼©å†™è¯­æ³•

    enum Student{
    case Name(String)
    case Mark(Int,Int,Int)
}
var studDetails = Student.Name("Runoob")
var studMarks = Student.Mark(98,97,95)
switch studMarks {
case .Name(let studName):
    print("å­¦ç”Ÿçš„åå­—æ˜¯: \(studName)ã€‚")
case .Mark(let Mark1, let Mark2, let Mark3):
    print("å­¦ç”Ÿçš„æˆç»©æ˜¯: \(Mark1),\(Mark2),\(Mark3)ã€‚")
}

    æ•´æ•°çš„æšä¸¾æ—¶ï¼Œä¸éœ€è¦æ˜¾å¼çš„ä¸ºæ¯ä¸€ä¸ªæˆå‘˜èµ‹å€¼ï¼ŒSwiftä¼šè‡ªåŠ¨ä¸ºä½ èµ‹å€¼ã€‚

    enum Month: Int {
    case January = 1, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December
}
let yearMonth = Month.May.rawValue
print("æ•°å­—æœˆä»½ä¸º: \(yearMonth)ã€‚")

  33. ç»“æ„ä½“æ€»æ˜¯é€šè¿‡è¢«å¤åˆ¶çš„æ–¹å¼åœ¨ä»£ç ä¸­ä¼ é€’ï¼Œå› æ­¤å®ƒçš„å€¼æ˜¯ä¸å¯ä¿®æ”¹çš„ã€‚

  34. æ’ç­‰è¿ç®—ç¬¦:=== ä¸æ’ç­‰è¿ç®—ç¬¦:!==

  35. å»¶è¿Ÿå­˜å‚¨å±æ€§

    class sample {
    lazy var no = number() // `var` å…³é”®å­—æ˜¯å¿…é¡»çš„
}

  36. å±æ€§è§‚å¯Ÿå™¨

item.title: HD Walletçš„BIP32, BIP39, BIP44
item.description:
HD Walletçš„BIP32, BIP39, BIP44

Hierarchical Deterministic wallet (ç®€ç§° â€œHD Walletâ€)

BIP32ï¼šæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªç³»ç»Ÿå¯ä»¥ä»å•ä¸€ä¸ª seed äº§ç”Ÿä¸€æ ‘çŠ¶ç»“æ„å‚¨å­˜å¤šç»„ keypairsï¼ˆç§é’¥å’Œå…¬é’¥ï¼‰

BIP44ï¼šåŸºäº BIP32 çš„ç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œèµ‹äºˆæ ‘çŠ¶ç»“æ„ä¸­çš„å„å±‚ç‰¹æ®Šçš„æ„ä¹‰ã€‚è®©åŒä¸€ä¸ª seed å¯ä»¥æ”¯æ´å¤šå¸ç§ã€å¤šå¸æˆ·ç­‰ã€‚å„å±‚å®šä¹‰å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š

item.title: My First Markdown Article
item.description:
My First Markdown Article

Tool

I search which one is suitable for my macOS, so I got Typora Editor from Zhihu Mac ä¸Šæœ€å¥½çš„ Markdown æ–‡æœ¬ç¼–è¾‘å™¨æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Ÿ. I installed it, and now is Practicing to write Markdown in Typora Editor.

Knowledge points

I learned how to write in markdown format from this website..Which shows me how to basic operations.The following list skill is to be learned.

  • Images

    ![image](your image url)

    Mark:here for me is not easy to find the key to type â€œ``â€ .I donâ€™t know how to center the text.Now I know Markdown doesnâ€™t support text alignment.I try the html format to center the abvoe lineï¼š<center>![image](your image url)</center>, but it failed.So I used <p style="text-align:center"><code>![image](your image url)</code></p>.

  • Headers

    Using like this

    A First Level Header
====================
A Second Level Header
---------------------
### Header 3

  • Lists

    â€‹

    Simple List is easy to learn. Sorry to find that web page doesnâ€™t support for Task List.

    â€‹

  • Tables

    | First Header | Second Header | | â€”â€”â€”â€” | â€”â€”â€”â€”- | | Content Cell | Content Cell | | Content Cell | Content Cell | â€‹

    Using like this:Fuckï¼Web page dosenâ€™t uspport!!!

      | First Header  | Second Header |
  | ------------- | ------------- |
  | Content Cell  | Content Cell  |
  | Content Cell  | Content Cell  |

  • Horizontal Rules

Input *** or â€” on a blank line and press return will draw a horizontal line.

  • Code Fences

    function test() {
  console.log("notice the blank line before this function?");
}

  • Mathematics

  • Diagrams

  • Inline Styles.

Plans

  1. learn writting skill continuously and update this article.
  2. read some book about blockchain.ect. I read the book ã€Šç²¾é€šæ¯”ç‰¹å¸ã€‹
  3. read some fucking open source code about blockchain. especally bitcoin.
  4. I have to write some articles in my blog .
